channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-18120] Hadoop auth does not handle HTTP Headers in a case-insensitive way
item.description:
According to RFC-2616 HTTP Headers are case-insensitive. There are proxies / load balancers (e.g.: newer versions of HA-proxy) which deliberately make some of the HTTP headers lower-case results in an authentication / authorization failure inside the Hadoop codebase.

I've created a small patch (I'm from Cloudera): [^hadoop-auth-headers.patch]. This resolves our authentication issue. Can someone please have a look at this?
item.summary: Hadoop auth does not handle HTTP Headers in a case-insensitive way

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: It would be nice to add a test to it.

weichiu, I won't be able to handle this ticket, sorry. I don't have time right now. That's why I mentioned that it would be great if someone else could check it. Since the coding part is pretty much done, there's not much left.

-1 overall
